cookingMethod: In a large bowl, mix together the flour, baking powder and sugar. In another bowl, beat together the eggs and milk. Add the wet ingredients to the dry ingredients and mix until just combined. Melt some butter on a hot griddle and pour in some batter. Cook until bubbles form on the surface and then flip and cook for another minute.

Form the ground beef into a patty and season with salt and pepper. Grill the patty on a hot grill for about 3 minutes per side. Toast the bun on the grill. Assemble the burger by placing the patty on the bottom bun and topping with lettuce, tomato, cheese and ketchup. Serve immediately.

In a large bowl, mix together the flour and sugar. Cut in the butter until the mixture resembles coarse crumbs. Peel and slice the apples and toss with cinnamon. Place half of the flour mixture in a pie dish and top with the apples. Cover with the remaining flour mixture. Bake in a preheated oven at 375°F for about 45 minutes.

In a large bowl, mix together the ground beef, bread crumbs, milk, egg and onion. Season with salt and pepper. Shape into a loaf and place in a baking dish. Spread ketchup on top of the meatloaf. Bake in a preheated oven at 350°F for about 1 hour.

In a shallow dish, mix together the flour, paprika and garlic powder. In another dish, beat together the egg and milk. Dip the chicken pieces in the egg mixture and then coat in the flour mixture. Heat oil in a deep fryer and fry the chicken until golden brown and cooked through.

In a small bowl, mix together the brown sugar, paprika, garlic powder and onion powder. Rub the mixture all over the ribs. Place the ribs in a baking dish and cover with foil. Bake in a preheated oven at 300°F for about 3 hours. Remove the foil and brush the ribs with bbq sauce. Bake for another 30 minutes.

In a large pot, cook the diced potatoes in boiling water until tender. Drain and set aside. In the same pot, melt the butter and cook the onion and celery until softened. Add the clams and cook for a few minutes. Add the milk and cooked potatoes and heat through. Serve hot.

In a large bowl, toss together the chopped romaine lettuce and croutons. In a small bowl, whisk together the lemon juice, garlic and olive oil. Drizzle the dressing over the salad and toss to coat. Sprinkle with parmesan cheese and serve immediately.

Butter one side of each slice of bread. Place a slice of cheese between the slices of bread with the buttered sides facing out. Heat a skillet over medium heat and cook the sandwich until the bread is golden brown and the cheese is melted.
Preheat the oven to 350°F. Mix all ingredients in a bowl. Place the mixture into a loaf pan and bake for 1 hour. Let rest for 10 minutes before slicing and serving.

Cook the macaroni according to package instructions. In a saucepan, melt butter over medium heat. Whisk in flour until smooth. Gradually stir in milk. Bring to a boil and cook, stirring constantly, for 2 minutes. Reduce heat and stir in cheeses until melted. Add cooked macaroni and salt to cheese sauce and stir to combine. Serve hot.

Preheat oven to 375 degrees F (190 degrees C). In a saucepan, combine chicken, carrots, peas, and potatoes. Add enough water to cover and boil for 15 minutes. In another saucepan, cook butter and flour over low heat until the mixture turns golden brown. Add milk and stir until smooth. Add the chicken mixture to the saucepan and mix well. Pour the mixture into a 9-inch pie dish. Top with pastry crust and bake for 30 minutes.

Preheat oven to 375 degrees F (190 degrees C). In a saucepan, combine chicken, carrots, peas, and potatoes. Add enough water to cover and boil for 15 minutes. In another saucepan, cook butter and flour over low heat until the mixture turns golden brown. Add milk and stir until smooth. Add the chicken mixture to the saucepan and mix well. Pour the mixture into a 9-inch pie dish. Top with pastry crust and bake for 30 minutes.

This Chicken Salad is quick and easy to make. Start by cooking the chicken and let it cool. Once it's cooled, chop the chicken into small pieces and add it to a bowl with lettuce, tomatoes, cucumbers, carrots, and croutons. Mix well and serve!

To make this delicious breakfast burrito, start by cooking the sausage and potatoes in a skillet. Then, scramble the eggs and add them to the skillet. Once everything is cooked, place the mixture into a tortilla, add cheese, and wrap it up. Serve hot and enjoy!

Preheat oven to 325°F. Rub the pork shoulder with your favorite BBQ seasoning and place in a roasting pan. Add 1 cup of water to the bottom of the pan. Cover tightly with foil and bake for 4-5 hours or until the pork is tender and falls apart easily. Remove from the oven and let cool for 10 minutes. Shred the pork with two forks and mix in the BBQ sauce. Toast the hamburger buns and top with the pulled pork, pickles, and red onion.

Cook the macaroni according to package instructions. In a separate saucepan, melt the butter over medium heat. Whisk in the flour and cook for 1-2 minutes until smooth. Gradually whisk in the milk and continue to cook, whisking constantly, until the mixture thickens. Remove from heat and stir in the shredded cheddar cheese until melted. Add the cooked macaroni to the cheese sauce and mix well. Pour into a greased baking dish and sprinkle with the grated parmesan cheese. Bake at 350°F for 20-25 minutes or until golden brown and bubbly.

In a large skillet, cook chicken over medium heat until no longer pink. Stir in taco seasoning. Heat tortillas according to package directions. Serve chicken in tortillas; top with lettuce and tomatoes.

Preheat oven to 425°F. Roll out pizza dough on a floured surface. Spread bbq sauce over dough, leaving a 1-inch border. Top with cheese, chicken, and onion. Bake for 15-18 minutes, until crust is golden brown. Garnish with cilantro.

Cook macaroni according to package directions. In a large saucepan, melt butter over medium heat. Stir in flour until smooth. Gradually whisk in milk. Bring to a boil; cook and stir for 2 minutes or until thickened. Reduce heat; stir in cheese until melted. Drain macaroni; stir into cheese sauce. Serve immediately.

Preheat oven to 350°F. Cook macaroni according to package instructions. In a saucepan, melt butter over medium heat. Stir in flour and cook for 1 minute. Gradually stir in milk. Cook, stirring constantly, until sauce thickens. Stir in cheese until melted. Add macaroni to sauce and mix well. Transfer to a baking dish and sprinkle with breadcrumbs. Bake for 30 minutes or until golden brown.

In a bowl, whisk together lemon juice, olive oil, garlic, and anchovy paste. Season with salt and pepper. In a large bowl, toss romaine lettuce with dressing. Add croutons and parmesan cheese and toss again. Serve immediately.
